value.title: Machine-Learning Program Connects to Human Brain and Commands Robots
value.excerpt: Researchers at Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne have developed a machine-learning program that can be connected to a human brain and used to command a robot. The program can alter the robot’s movements based on electrical signals from the brain.

value.title: Face detection in untrained deep neural networks
value.excerpt: Researchers have found that higher visual cognitive functions can arise spontaneously in untrained neural networks. A KAIST research team led by Professor Se-Bum Paik from the Department of Bio and Brain Engineering has shown that visual selectivity of facial images can arise even in completely untrained deep neural networks.

value.title: The Global Deep Learning Market is Projected to Reach US$60.5 Billion by 2025
value.excerpt: Deep learning is a division of machine learning that uses layered algorithmic models for analyzing data. The deep learning market is gaining prominence on account of its complex data-driven applications including voice and image recognition.
